lines.line: Your Majesty.
That fool Sigrid! What does she think she's doing?
Excuse me, your Majesty?
Ah,. I apologise, but I'm rather busy at the moment.
What's going on, your Majesty?
I'm busy,. You'd better talk to Ghrim.
Your Majesty...
Vargas, you irritating fool. 'Warmongering harpy', indeed!
Sorry?
Oh, I apologise. I was merely thinking out loud.
How is your kingdom faring?
It could be better. Now, if you don't mind, I'm rather busy.
Very well, your Majesty.
Greetings, Your Royal Highness.
What am I meant to be doing again?
Dealing with all the little troubles that come up from time to time, Your Royal Highness.
Such as the predicament we are now in.
What do you mean?
Has anything been happening in the kingdom recently?
Interesting that you should ask that, Your Royal Highness.
You see, the people are worried that war will break out again.
King Vargas has found himself with little to do now that you are the regent. He intended, at first, to return to adventuring.
Unfortunately, we still have not had the doors to the throne room enlarged so that he can leave...
So, what has he been doing?
He has been trying to rule once more, in your absence. However, he has once again quarrelled with the Queen of Etceteria.
The two of them have been writing letters to each other, threatening to raise armies and declare war on each other once more!
I see.
Your Royal Highness, I suggest that you deal with this matter and reconcile the two of them again. Such a quarrel is not good for Miscellania.
Very well, I'll sort it out.
Thank you, Your Royal Highness.
I suggest you talk to the prince and princess to find out more about the situation.
Princess Astrid has been asking after you. She would very much like to see you once again.
Prince Brand has been asking after you. He would very much like to see you once again.
No, I don't have the time at the moment.
You are the regent of this kingdom, Your Royal Highness. I would urge you to reconsider.
However, you are also a busy hero, and thus I understand your reluctance.
I'm sorry, but I'm very busy. Talk to my son and daughter if Ghrim can't help you.
Talking to the Prince and Princess, Your Royal Highness. I believe they have something to ask you.
Good day, your Highness.
Good day,. Have you come to see my sister?
Yes, Advisor Ghrim said I should talk to both of you about recent events in the kingdom.
Hello, dear.
Welcome back, dear!
I'm afraid I haven't managed to find a priest for our marriage yet.
That's a pity.
Oh, Advisor Ghrim said I should talk to you and the Princess about recent events in the kingdom.
I'll ask Father if he minds us discussing this in the throne room for a while.
Advisor Ghrim told me to talk to you about the situation in Miscellania.
What has happened while I've been away?
It's terrible, my dear! My father's been arguing with the Queen of Etceteria, and has managed to start a war again.
It's awful that your work has been undone by such an accident.
What do you mean, 'an accident'?
Well, if my father had had something to occupy him, he wouldn't have gotten bored and decided to argue with Queen Sigrid again.
What would you suggest he do, then?
We can't have him declaring war all the time. Even if it would give us a chance to show off our military might.
And I could finally show him that archery isn't a cowardly skill. If only we had an army, we could prove ourselves against the Etceterians.
Astrid, I have an even better idea.
Better than archery? What is it?
I think we should persuade our father and Queen Sigrid to marry!
...What are you talking about, Brand?
Think of the poetic irony of the situation!
The best part is that I could write their wedding hymn for them.
'Today is a happy day, we are getting married,
Our national anthems are wonderful, won't you sing this song?'
I'm not sure that's such a good idea...
I think it will work.
I quite agree!
Perhaps it's an odd idea, my dear, but since we don't have an army, we can hardly declare war...
Are you sure it'll work?
Of course it will! It always happens in the ballads and stories.
Two people who start out hating each other, and end up falling in love. It's a classic tale.
That doesn't always work...
But we don't have an army, so it's our best hope.
So, will you talk to our father and Queen Sigrid, then?
I'm sure you can manage to arrange it all.
I'll give it a try. But they'll still be angry with each other, so I don't think it'll work.
I'm sure you'll manage to do it, dear.
Good day,. Have you come to see my brother?
Welcome back, dear!
I'm afraid I haven't managed to find a priest for our marriage yet.
Oh, Advisor Ghrim said I should talk to you and the Prince about recent events in the kingdom.
I'll ask Father if he minds us discussing this in the throne room for a while.
It's terrible, my ! My father's been arguing with the Queen of Etceteria, and has managed to start a war again.
It's awful that your work has been undone by such an accident.
Well, if my father had had something to occupy him, he wouldn't have gotten bored and decided to argue with Queen Sigrid again.
I think it will work.
I quite agree!
Perhaps it's an odd idea, my, but since we don't have an army, we can hardly declare war...
I trust my brother's judgement.
Though his ideas can sometimes be a little... strange.
What was that, Astrid?
I'm just telling about your poetic accomplishments.
Oh, that's all right, then.
So, will you talk to our father and Queen Sigrid, then?
I'm sure you can manage to arrange it all.
I'm sure you'll manage to do it,.
What is it? You'll have to excuse me, I'm quite busy...
What are you busy with, your Majesty?
Affairs of state, and so on.
I thought I was supposed to deal with those, once you appointed me Regent.
Well, there's not all that much for me to do these days, you see.
And though you do make a fine regent, you cannot be here all the time.
So you're still helping to rule, your Majesty?
In a manner of speaking.
These 'affairs of state' you're dealing with...
Would these involve starting a war with Queen Sigrid of Etceteria?
Not exactly...
Well, yes. Of course, Sigrid was the one who insulted me first.
And that's the least of the kingdom's problems at the moment.
Some of Frodi's barrels are missing, as are many of Magnus's crates. Leif also says he's had stacks of wood disappear.
Since you're the regent, you should investigate what has happened to these missing resources.
Right away, your majesty.
I'm glad to see the kingdom in such capable hands.
I'm sorry, I have some other things to do.
That never prevented me from ruling this kingdom when I was your age,.
Well, I suppose I could spare a little time.
I'm glad to have your help.
All you need to do for the moment is to talk to the citizens of Miscellania, and find out what has been happening.
It might also be useful to interrogate the citizens of Etceteria to see what they know.
Have you managed to make peace between my father and Queen Sigrid yet?
Not quite yet.
Have you managed to make peace between my father and Queen Sigrid yet?
Good day, Your Royal Highness.
King Vargas tells me that things have been going missing from the kingdom. Can you tell me anything about this?
You mean you hadn't heard, Your Royal Highness? Etceterian soldiers came and demanded tithes from us.
You're the only person we give any of our goods to, so we refused, and found the next day that some of our goods had been stolen.
Good day, Your Royal Highness.
You hadn't heard about it, Your Royal Highness? Etceterian soldiers came and demanded tithes from us.
You're the only person we give any of our goods to, so we refused, and found the next day that some of our goods had been stolen.
Good day, Your Royal Highness.
You mean you don't know, Your Royal Highness? Etceterian soldiers came and demanded tithes from us.
You're the only person we give any of our goods to, so we refused, and found the next day that some of our goods had been stolen.
Have you spoken to the citizens yet, ?
I've spoken to the Miscellanean citizens.
And?
They say that the Etceterian army demanded tithes from them, and took some of their goods even though they refused.
What?
So, Sigrid's planning to invade, is she?
Or perhaps she's claiming that Miscellania is part of Etceteria now!
, go and talk to Sigrid and ask her what she thinks she's doing.
Exchanging angry letters is understandable, but where did she get an army from?
I'll talk to her right away, your Majesty.
Your Majesty, do you have a moment?
Incompetent! I'll give him 'incompetent'...
Yes, what is it?
I hear from King Vargas that relations between Etceteria and Miscellania are none too cordial at the moment.
Of course not!
That idiot Vargas has decided to take a hand in ruling Miscellania, even though he'd handed it over to you, and now he's declared war on Etceteria again!
I suppose all those insults I made about his parentage can't have helped the matter...
Even so, that doesn't excuse what he did to my citizens!
What happened, your Majesty?
My citizens have told me that items of theirs have been taken, and I'm sure that Vargas is behind it.
Since you're the one who's supposed to be ruling Miscellania, you should sort it out.
I'm glad you understand.
If you talk to the citizens of Etceteria, they will tell you exactly what happened.
I would find out for myself, but the pressures of ruling are immense, and I would never have the time free.
Of course not, it's not my fault.
What sort of Regent of Miscellania do you call yourself?
Of course it's your fault. You rule the country now.
I suppose you're right...
Excuse me...
Yes?
Queen Sigrid tells me that things have been going missing from the kingdom. Can you tell me anything about this?
You haven't heard about that until now?
I'm surprised.
Well, Miscellanian soldiers came and asked for tribute.
When I told them to leave, they came back the next day and stole my hat!
It was a wonderful hat. Mithril-reinforced, you see, and with a special splitbark brim to keep the sun off.
Could you please get it back for me?
I'll see what I can do.
Yes, can I help you?
You're the regent of Miscellania, aren't you?
I'm surprised you didn't know about your own soldiers demanding tribute from us.
I told them to go away, but the next day I found that they'd stolen my small shield!
How am I supposed to defend the house without it?
And what am I going to use as a fruit bowl in the meantime?
Please sort out your soldiers, and get my shield back to me.
What is it?
Curse those Miscellanian soldiers!
They came and demanded tribute, and even though I told them to go away, they came back at night and stole my farming tools!
Without my trowel and fork, I can't do anything to keep the weeds from the farming patch.
Please, find my tools again, so I can get back to work.
What is it?
You didn't know about it?
Miscellanian soldiers came here a few days ago, saying they wanted us to pay tribute.
Of course, I told them to leave.
But in the morning, I found they'd stolen my quiver of arrows!
They're not very valuable arrows, but I need them to do my job. Could you get them back for me?
Yes, what is it?
You mean you haven't heard?
Only a few days ago, we had Miscellanian soldiers come round and ask for tribute.
I told them to get lost, of course...
...but when I woke up the next morning, they'd stolen my sword!
Could you get it back for me? I doubt it can cut anything, but it once belonged to my great-grandfather.
So it's a family heirloom, you see.
Have you talked to the citizens yet, ?
I've talked to the Miscellanian citizens as well as the Etceterians.
What exactly happened?
The Etceterian citizens said that Miscellanian soldiers came to their houses and demanded tribute...
Just as I suspected! Vargas, you treacherous snake!
...and the Miscellanian citizens said that the Etceterian army marched into their fields and demanded tithes!
What?
Now I see his plan! Vargas isn't content with simply arguing; he wants to start a war even if it means swindling his own citizens!
Your Majest-
Etceterian army? There hasn't been one for centuries! These Miscellanian soldiers of his must have disguised themselves.
If I may-
And since Vargas shouldn't even be ruling now, it's your responsibility to deal with this.
The one who should sort this out is you.
I suppose you're right.
Me?
It's one of the hazards of ruling a country,.
Have you found those stolen items yet?
Not yet, your Majesty.
You'd better hurry and look for them.
We don't know what Vargas might be planning next!
I've spoken to the Miscellanian citizens, and also the Etceterians.
What did they say?
The Miscellanian citizens said that the Etceterian army marched into their fields and demanded tithes...
I see. Sigrid thinks that now I've recognised Etceteria as a sovereign nation, I'll just roll over and play dead when she tries to invade, does she?
...and the Etceterian citizens said that Miscellanian soldiers came to their houses and demanded tribute!
And she's even started spreading rumours among her own citizens! Are there no depths to which she won't sink?
Lying to her own people about there being Miscellanian soldiers... we don't even have an army!
Which makes it all the worse, as otherwise I'd be able to invade Etceteria to save the citizens from Sigrid's depravity.
I'm not sure that would work very well, your Majesty.
Perhaps not,.
In any case, if there are any 'Miscellanian soldiers', they must have come from somewhere.
Ask Advisor Ghrim if he knows who they might be, or where they might have come from.
He's a capable advisor, so I'm sure he'll know about any suspicious people.
I'll do that, your Majesty.
King Vargas asked me to talk to you.
He said you might know more about the missing goods.
I'm not sure what you're implying, Your Royal Highness.
Er... that you could advise me where to look for them?
Ah, of course.
Assuming that nobody presently living in Miscellania would have taken them,
it is of course likely that someone from outside took them.
The sailor who brought you here from the mainland would be the first to see any suspicious visitors.
I suggest you ask him about recent arrivals to the island.
...I believe the King asked you to talk to me, Your Royal Highness.
Yes, that's right.
I'm looking for a sailor...
You've found one here. Can I help you?
The King's advisor said I should talk to you. He said there have been some suspicious people arriving recently.
Well, I don't know of any suspicious people... Advisor Ghrim can be rather paranoid about these things sometimes.
Oh. Has anyone visited the island recently, then?
Nobody apart from you, and those kids from Rellekka.
What kids from Rellekka?
Five of them came over here a few weeks ago. They said they were here to see relatives in the dungeons, and they were visiting from the mainland.
I didn't realise the King kept people in his dungeons.
I didn't know Miscellania even HAD dungeons.
They've not been used to keep prisoners for a long time. But since the war ended, we've had more people visiting the island.
Some of them decided they wanted to stay, so we've had to find somewhere for them to live...
Only the weather on Miscellania is terrible, and nobody could build houses that would stand up to a strong wind. Etceteria is just the same.
So you decided to live in the dungeons instead?
Well, of course, they had to be enlarged first. There are still some dwarves working there, making more of the dungeons inhabitable before they move over to work in Etceteria.
If you're looking for those kids from Rellekka, you'll find them in those dungeons.
Why are you surprised about this, though? I thought you'd become the Regent.
I'm still an adventurer, and I can't be everywhere in Gielinor...
Sorry, but nobody's allowed down there by order of the King.
But I'm the Regent! I order you to let me go down there.
You're the Regent? Well, I didn't vote for you.
Sorry, 'Regent', nobody can go into the dungeons without the King's say-so.
What'll it take to convince you that I'm really the Regent?
If the King came and told me, then I'd believe it.
Or, if he can't come here himself, I suppose a royal proclamation would be fine.
A royal proclamation?
Does he have to shout it from the battlements, or something like that?
No, just his signature and a statement saying you're really the Regent would do.
Your Majesty, how do I get into the dungeons?
The dungeons?
Of course, how could I have forgotten?
I'm surprised I didn't tell you when you were appointed Regent.
It's okay, the sailor explained it to me.
He said that the only new arrivals on the island were some teenagers, who came from Rellekka to visit their relatives.
Those relatives were living in the houses in the dungeons.
Ah, so you wish to look in the dungeons in case these new arrivals are to blame?
I doubt that anyone with Miscellanian relatives would be at fault. However...
There is something I need you to do in the dungeons.
They are still being excavated, and the dwarven architects are finding new caves as they go. There have been reports of odd sightings in these new caves.
Perhaps they are monsters, waiting to devour unwary Miscellanians...
Whatever they are, I want you to look into it.
You are a member of the royal family, after all, so I know I can rely on your help.
Of course, your Majesty.
The guard by the dungeon entrance may not recognise you, since he was only hired recently. Here, take this scroll to show that you have access to the dungeons.
You'll find the entrance by the south-east corner of the palace.
Have you given that scroll to the guard yet?
I seem to have lost it.
Honestly... very well, I'll write you another one.
Try not to lose it this time.
Showing the dungeon guard that you have permission to enter, Your Royal Highness.
Look, the King gave me a scroll saying I have access to the dungeons. I have it right here.
Let's have a look, then.
Here you go.
Hmm... all seems to be in order.
All right, your Highness, you're free to go down there.
Try not to be eaten by monsters.
Welcome to Miscellania's first clothing store! We sell clothing made especially for Fremenniks and Dwarves.
Can I help you with anything, Your Royal Highness?
What's it like living down here?
It's very spacious. One of the dwarves said that the caves go on for miles!
I don't like these rumours I've heard about the other caves, though.
What rumours?
They say there might be monsters in there. You'd best talk to the dwarves who are excavating - they'd know about these stories.
Welcome to the Miscellania food store. We've only opened recently.
Would you like to buy anything, your Royal Highness?
The town's growing larger, and business is doing well.
I'm worried about the stories I've heard about monsters, though.
What stories about monsters?
I heard that one of the dwarves saw monsters in the other caves!
I don't know more than that, so you'd have to ask the dwarves.
Can I help you, your Royal Highness?
There's no rain or wind down here.
Some of the dwarves say that there's water in the other caves, and one of them says he's seen monsters in there.
Monsters? What sort of monsters?
I don't know, sorry. You'd better ask one of the dwarves about it.
Would you like to try some fine Miscellanian ale, Your Royal Highness?
Well, I say Miscellanian, but it's actually brewed on the mainland.
Would you like to try some anyway?
The dwarves living down here spend a lot of time and money in my inn.
One of them's been in here all day, and only bought one pint.
Could you ask him to at least order another drink?
What are you doing down here?
I'm waiting for my shift. I'm supposed to be digging once the others have finished.
I don't like the sound of these monsters, though.
Monsters?
I heard that Donal went exploring in the caves, and saw a huge monster.
If you want to know more about it, ask Thorodin - he's working on the excavation right now.
I'm working on the digging, of course.
It's a small excavation, so only two of us can work on it at a time.
Thorodin and Donal were working on it earlier, but I hear Donal's run off to hide in the inn.
Why is that?
Apparently he saw a monster when he was in the caves.
I'm not scared of monsters - I won't let them stop me from digging!
I'm waiting to work on the digging.
It's the first excavation I've worked on, and I'm looking forward to it.
I heard there were monsters in the other caves, though. I don't really want to meet them.
Donal saw them when he explored the caves. He's been in the inn ever since.
We're extending the cave so more people can live in it.
These Miscellanians aren't so bad. They appreciate the benefits of living underground.
...such as?
You don't get rained on, for example.
Of course, there are some problems, like the monsters Donal saw...
Someone saw a monster?
Could you tell me more? The King asked me to investigate.
One of the other dwarves who was working with us saw it. His name's Donal.
He went further into the caves to plan our excavations, and a while later he came out shaking.
He's been in the inn ever since.
Good day.
Have you spoken to Donal?
Not yet, no.
Well, if you want to hear stories about monsters, he's the best one to ask.
Not getting rained on, for example.
I have. The monster he talked about could be in the caves nearby.
You'd better get in there and do something about it, then.
It's not safe. I need to shore up the walls before I can go through.
What do you want?
What are you doing down in these caves?
I'm waiting to work on the excavations...
...though I don't really want to start digging again.
Why not? I thought digging was something dwarves were good at.
Not with monsters like that one in those caves.
It had huge teeth and flaming red eyes, and was almost the size of the tunnel!
If it attacks the town...
Are you an adventurer, by any chance?
Adventurer and Regent of Miscellania.
In that case, could you go and deal with that monster?
I don't want to have to face it again if it attacks the town.
Of course. Dealing with monsters is what I do best!
You'll need to get into the other caves first, of course.
There's a crack in the wall where the others are digging, but the rocks are loose, and can fall on you if you're not careful.
I can give you a mining prop to keep them from falling, if you give me a minute to find it...
Okay, so all I have to do is get through that wall?
No, after that the only way you can get further is climbing up onto a high ledge, then crawling through a tunnel.
But the walls are slippery...
...and I think I might have broken the lift when I fell off it on my way back.
You'll probably need to fix the lift - I doubt you'd be able to climb.
And the monster's behind that tunnel?
Somewhere behind it. I couldn't get very far, what with the flooding in the tunnel.
There's some rope and some planks near the broken lift - those would probably come in handy.
Ah, here's that mining prop. I knew I had it somewhere.
Here you go. Good luck with fighting that monster.
Why bother? It can't get through solid rock.
That's what I thought, until I saw the sheer size of it. This thing probably MADE the tunnels!
And you're sending me in to deal with it alone?
I've heard stories from the Miscellanians. If you're the Regent, you must be quite a strong hero.
So what are you worried about? You probably eat monsters like that for breakfast!
I wouldn't put it quite like that...
But I'll help you after all. Now, how do I find this monster?
Just wondering if you were still here.
Of course I'm still here.
I'm not going near that crack in the wall again.
Rock falls and so on are fine, but sea monsters in caves - never!
I've lost that mining prop you gave me...
Lucky I have a spare, isn't it?
I can see the embers of a fire up ahead. Has someone else been in these caves?
I should explore this cave more before I jump through any more cracks in the walls...
What do we do now?
If you hadn't got drunk in that inn, Signy, we could have stayed there for longer.
It wasn't just me who got drunk. You looked like you were about to puke all over the barmaid.
Reinn threw up anyway.
I can't help it, I just have a weak stomach.
You're no better, Hild. You said you knew where we were, and now look at us!
We're cold, we're hungry and now we're LOST!
We wouldn't have been so cold if Armod had more diary pages he'd let us use!
Hey! I have to write down what's happened.
Otherwise father won't believe me when I tell him.
If your father listened to what you say, we wouldn't BE here.
We'd have passed the trials and we'd be proper adults!
Besides, it's not like he'll even look at the rubbish you've written in your diary.
If only my father would come and save us.
If only SOMEONE would come and save us.
Someone's coming!
Quick, let's hide!
What if it's the monster again? What if it's one of the townspeople?
What if my father's found out what we've been doing?
H-hey! Where am I going to hide?
Shhhh! Just pretend you're part of the scenery, or something!
You're almost smart enough to make a good rock.
You want me to hit you?
Just act normal, Armod! And hurry!
O-okay.
Hello there.
Don't bother me!
I said, don't bother me!
I'm being a rock at the moment.
You can't be a rock. I heard you talking to people earlier.
What did you hear?
Your name's Armod, isn't it? I found your diary.
What? How did you get it? Give it back!
Not until you tell me what's going on.
Why should I tell you? We're going to do really well and show my father that we're true adults!
What, by starting a war?
What the-
Did you read my diary?
Yes, all of it.
What are you even doing in these caves anyway? Everyone else was scared to come down here.
Well, I'm the Regent of Miscellania. The King asked me to take a look-
You're the REGENT?
Um, you four, I think you'd better come out now. We're in big trouble.
Nice impression of a rock you did there, Armod.
So you're the adventurer we heard about, then. The one who married the.
So you're the adventurer we heard about, then. The one who gained the trust of the.
Yes, that's me.
And you five are the people mentioned in Armod's diary, right?
Armod, you should have burnt it all.
Did you steal those goods from the Etceterians and the Miscellanians?
It was Beigarth's idea, not mine!
He said that if we disguised ourselves as soldiers, we could convince both the King and Queen that they were under attack. And it almost worked, too.
It would have worked, if it hadn't been for that huge snake!
...What huge snake?
We put the things we'd taken somewhere safe, so we could get them back when we made peace again.
Everything was going well, until we got back to that place, and a giant sea snake had moved in!
It's made a nest out of all the boxes and barrels.
I don't care about the plan. If you can get rid of that sea snake, we'll be really grateful to you.
We can't even get out of these dungeons while it's there.
I agree with him. I want to go back home.
It's cold here, we've got no food, and we can't go back to the town.
Not after we got drunk and then didn't pay our bill.
So, will you get rid of that sea snake?
Of course. I was going to do that anyway.
Thank you so much. You've saved us from the brink of death.
Could I ask you for one more thing?
What is it?
PLEASE don't tell my father how badly we messed up.
Hello down there! Are you all right?
Who's that?
I'm up here, above this hole.
I've thrown down a rope - you sounded like you were trapped in there.
I'm surprised you managed to get out of there without breaking any bones.
Still, I can't let you go back down there until the Queen says it's safe.
I don't suppose you've seen a large box around here, have you?
Oh, so this is yours? You must have dropped it around here.
Seems rather heavy. Take better care of it this time.
Wait a minute! You can't go down there.
Why not? I came up through that hole...
Yes, and I'm surprised you managed to get out of there without breaking any bones.
If he wants an Etceterian army, then we'll have to raise one!
Your Majesty!
What is it?
I've found out what caused all these problems.
A group of teenagers from Rellekka came to Etceteria to prove themselves as adults.
They said they tried to start a war, which they'd then stop, and be hailed as peacemakers.
They were the ones who disguised themselves as soldiers!
Hmm...
That explains what the citizens said about armies, I suppose.
But what about the items that went missing?
Well, there was a minor problem involving a sea snake...
But I dealt with it, and got the items back.
Finally, a ruler of Miscellania who's willing to do something for his neighbours.
Do you have the items with you?
...I must have dropped the box on my way out of the dungeons.
*sigh* Well, if you ask the guard at the entrance to the dungeon, he might have picked it up.
Of course, he won't know what it's for, so you'd better bring it back here once you find it.
I shall do, your Majesty.
Yes, I have them here.
Thank you,. You've shown yourself to be an excellent diplomat and warrior - not a combination that comes naturally to many.
My citizens would like their items back, of course. One of my guards will deal with the items for you, and you will be provided with a suitable reward.
Finally... I have a letter that I would like you to give to Vargas. This war was a mistake, and I've made a formal apology.
I'll make sure to give it to him, your Majesty.
Thank you for all your help,. To show our gratitude, the woodcutters and other workers of Etceteria have pledged to add a proportion of what they produce to your treasury.
Now that you've finished giving these items back, please give my letter to Vargas.
I'm glad you've found my citizens' missing items, Dalkar. Have you had a chance to give Vargas my letter?
Oh, that's a pity.
Hurry up and give it to him, please. It means we can formally declare peace again.
I'm afraid I've lost it.
Very well, I'll write another. Try to take better care of this one.
I'm not sure I should be reading this...
I won't read that letter. It's for the King, not for me.
Oh, why not. I'm the Regent, after all.
How are your investigations going, ?
I've found the people who took the goods from your citizens!
Those Etceterian soldiers?
They weren't Etceterian soldiers after all.
They were teenagers from Rellekka who were trying to prove themselves as adults, by starting a war and then bringing about peace.
Why didn't they just go through the trials as usual?
Unless they're the ones that the Council warned me about.
Still, I can't believe they'd start a war between Miscellania and Etceteria, just to show they were adults...
But at least you've found the missing goods. Do you have them with you?
I'm afraid not, your Majesty. There were far too many for me to carry.
That's a pity.
We'll have to send people down to collect them later, then.
And I also spoke to Queen Sigrid of Etceteria.
She gave me a letter for you, which she said was a formal apology.
Oh? Do you have this letter with you?
Er, I had it, but I seem to have lost it.
You'd better ask Sigrid to write you another one, then.
I'd like to see what she has to say.
Of course, your Majesty. Here you are.
Let me see...
You defeated that sea snake? Sigrid seems rather impressed with that.
And the caverns underneath her palace are joined to ours, I see.
She thinks we should join forces to develop them for more houses.
Finally... hmm. That's not what I'd have expected from Sigrid.
What is it, your Majesty?
She, erm, says if I weren't a yeti, she might want to get to know me better.
Since we're both warmongering fools, she thinks we'd get on well.
I suppose she has a point there.
Brand's suggestion worked, and I didn't even do anything.
What was that?
Nothing, your Majesty.
Do you want me to give a reply to Queen Sigrid?
No, no. I'll think about it for a while.
Though I'd like to tell her I'm sorry for calling her a warmongering harpy.
In the meantime, you have managed to avert a war and bring the culprits to light.
The kingdom of Miscellania will have to reward you for this.
I hear that the Etceterians are also grateful for your help, and have pledged some of their resources.
You can talk to Ghrim to deal with those, just as before.
Thank you for your work in bringing peace back to these islands,.
I hear that the Etceterians have also pledged to give you some of their resources, as thanks for preventing war once again.
How is the kingdom faring?
Everything is fine, your Majesty.
Remember, speak to Ghrim if you require assistance.
I hear you made peace between our kingdom and Etceteria once more. Well done, ].
I hear you made peace between our kingdom and Etceteria once more. Well done, ].
Thank you for all your help,. It's good to know that the Regent of Miscellania is willing to help his neighbours.
You're welcome, your Majesty.

characters.name: Advisor Ghrim
characters.description: Middle-aged male, Scandinavian accent, perpetually stern and serious tone, a royal advisor who hasn't smiled since ancient times and approaches matters with formal gravitas.

characters.name: Alviss
characters.description: Middle-aged male dwarf, gruff Scottish-like accent, scholarly yet practical tone, a mining dwarf who researches the history between dwarves and Fremenniks in his spare time.

characters.name: Armod
characters.description: Teenage male, Scandinavian accent, nervous and defensive tone, the son of Brundt the Chieftain who keeps a diary and tends to panic when confronted about his schemes.

characters.name: Arnor
characters.description: Adult male, Scandinavian accent, matter-of-fact tone, an ordinary Etceterian citizen who values his family heirloom sword despite it being too dull to cut anything.

characters.name: Ashild
characters.description: Adult female, Scandinavian accent, frustrated and hardworking tone, an Etceterian farmer who cannot tend her land without her stolen gardening tools.

characters.name: Beigarth
characters.description: Teenage male, Scandinavian accent, scheming and ambitious tone, the ringleader who devised the plan to fake a war between Miscellania and Etceteria.

characters.name: Donal
characters.description: Middle-aged male dwarf, Scottish-like accent, anxious and frightened tone, a scared-looking dwarf miner who saw the giant sea snake and refuses to return to the caves.

characters.name: Finn
characters.description: Adult male, Scandinavian accent, practical and content tone, a general store owner who moved underground to escape the cold northern weather.

characters.name: Fullangr
characters.description: Middle-aged male dwarf, gruff Scottish-like accent, fearless and determined tone, a miner who refuses to let monsters stop him from digging.

characters.name: Gardener Gunnhild
characters.description: Middle-aged female, Scandinavian accent, polite and hardworking tone, a humble gardener who tends the patches around Miscellania Castle.

characters.name: Guard
characters.description: Adult male, Scandinavian accent, dutiful but skeptical tone, a recently hired dungeon guard who takes his orders from the King very seriously.

characters.name: Halla
characters.description: Adult female, Scandinavian accent, cheerful and welcoming tone, a clothing shop owner who adapts well to underground living despite occasionally making cutting mistakes.

characters.name: Helga
characters.description: Adult female, Scandinavian accent, indignant and practical tone, an Etceterian Fremennik woman upset about her stolen shield which doubled as her fruit bowl.

characters.name: Hild
characters.description: Teenage female, Scandinavian accent, frustrated and sarcastic tone, a Fremennik teenager who repeatedly got lost in navigation trials and wants to appear heroic.

characters.name: Jari
characters.description: Adult female dwarf, gruff Scottish-like accent, eager and nervous tone, a dwarf working on her first excavation who is worried about the monster rumors.

characters.name: King Vargas
characters.description: Older male transformed into a yeti, deep booming voice with Scandinavian accent, authoritative yet frustrated tone, a former adventurer trapped in his throne room by his massive size.

characters.name: Lumberjack Leif
characters.description: Adult male, Scandinavian accent, steady and good-natured tone, a hardworking lumberjack who methodically chops maple logs east of the castle.

characters.name: Matilda
characters.description: Adult female, Scandinavian accent, proud and particular tone, an Etceterian citizen who cherishes her special mithril-reinforced hat with splitbark brim.

characters.name: Miner Magnus
characters.description: Adult male, Scandinavian accent, straightforward and diligent tone, a coal miner who focuses on his work and keeps to his own business.

characters.name: Moldof
characters.description: Adult male, Scandinavian accent, calm and cooperative tone, an ordinary Etceterian villager who helps investigate the conflicts between the islands.

characters.name: Osvald
characters.description: Adult male, Scandinavian accent, optimistic and entrepreneurial tone, a food shop owner who believes the underground settlement will rival Rellekka someday.

characters.name: Prince Brand
characters.description: Young adult male, Scandinavian accent, romantic and poetic tone, a vain prince who fancies himself an amazing poet and loves cake.

characters.name: Princess Astrid
characters.description: Young adult female, Scandinavian accent, confident and competitive tone, a vain princess who is passionate about archery and eager to prove herself.

characters.name: Queen Sigrid
characters.description: Middle-aged female, Scandinavian accent, sharp and irritable tone, a queen who married into royalty and finds ruling tedious, harboring a love-hate relationship with King Vargas.

characters.name: Reinn
characters.description: Teenage male, Scandinavian accent, whiny and queasy tone, a Fremennik teenager with a weak stomach who often complains about their situation.

characters.name: Runa
characters.description: Adult female, Scandinavian accent, friendly and attentive tone, the barmaid of the Esoterican Arms who serves drinks to the dwarven miners.

characters.name: Sailor
characters.description: Adult male, Scandinavian accent, casual and informative tone, a sailor who ferries people to the islands and keeps track of arrivals.

characters.name: Signy
characters.description: Teenage female, Scandinavian accent, defiant and reckless tone, a Fremennik teenager who got sick during drinking contests and nearly caused furnace accidents during her failed trials.

characters.name: Thorodin
characters.description: Middle-aged male dwarf, gruff Scottish-like accent, authoritative and practical tone, the leader of the dwarven mining crew who appreciates underground living.
